newsitem.title: USA: Intuit sees lower rev growth in fiscal 1997.
newsitem.headline: Intuit sees lower rev growth in fiscal 1997.

text.p: Intuit Inc said Monday it expects a lower revenue growth rate and a modest improvement in operating margin during fiscal 1997.
Intuit, which remains cautious in its outlook for the consumer software industry, also said it expects to report operating losses for the fiscal 1997 July and October quarters.
The July and October quarter operating losses are due to operating expenses necessary to develop updated product versions, Intuit said.
Intuit also said it's revenues and operating profits are typically lower in the July and October quarters.
"We will continue to run our business focusing on long-term results, not quarterly results," the company said in a prepared statement.

For the fiscal 1996 fourth quarter, Intuit reported a net loss of $22.0 million, or $0.48 per share, including charges, on revenues of $91.1 million. This compared with a net loss of $1.4 million, or $0.03 per share on revenues of $72.4 million a year ago.

Excluding acquisition-related charges, Intuit would have reported a fourth quarter net loss of $7.7 million or $0.17 per share, compared with a net loss, excluding acquisition-related charges and the gain from the Microsoft termination fee, of $6.6 million or $0.15 per share a year ago.
